name: Afghan Refugee Relief
mission: Afghan Refugee Relief (ARR) is a proud, 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization focused on resettling refugees, asylum-seekers and humanitarian parolees in Southern California.
zakatClaimEvidence: No explicit mention of "zakat" on the official website or donation pages of Afghan Refugee Relief found in the search results. The organization's mission is to help incoming Afghan refugees successfully resettle, assimilate, and thrive in America, providing services like financial aid, women empowerment, and tutoring. While they partner with some Islamic organizations, there is no direct evidence that Afghan Refugee Relief (the US-based charity) explicitly accepts zakat donations. (Source: https://www.afghanrefugeerelief.org/home)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Limited match due to weaker results and/or higher uncertainty; review methodology details before deciding.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Program expense ratio critically low: 29%

score_details.score_summary: Afghan Refugee Relief shows good impact and moderate alignment (minor risk deductions applied). Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

zakat.claim_evidence: No explicit mention of "zakat" on the official website or donation pages of Afghan Refugee Relief found in the search results. The organization's mission is to help incoming Afghan refugees successfully resettle, assimilate, and thrive in America, providing services like financial aid, women empowerment, and tutoring. While they partner with some Islamic organizations, there is no direct evidence that Afghan Refugee Relief (the US-based charity) explicitly accepts zakat donations. (Source: https://www.afghanrefugeerelief.org/home)

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a program expense ratio of 28.9% and holds 1.3 months of working capital.
The charity manages Program 1, Project Sabr, and financial aid programs, including the distribution of laptops and grants.
The organization accepts various donation methods and is identified as sadaqah-eligible.
Passionate volunteers are a core component of the organization's community-based resettlement efforts.
The organization reported total revenue of $205,225 and a fundraising efficiency of $0.07 per $1 raised.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a moderate overall score due to its direct humanitarian impact and efficient fundraising, though it is constrained by a low program expense ratio and limited data transparency.
areas_for_improvement: Low program expense ratio of 28.9%, indicating a high proportion of spending on non-programmatic costs
Limited financial cushion with only 1.3 months of working capital available

dimension_explanations.alignment: While the organization addresses a high-urgency humanitarian cause, the alignment score is moderate due to a low donor fit for those seeking high-transparency institutions [1]. The organization offers various ways to engage through volunteering and sadaqah-eligible donations [3][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a direct service impact by distributing financial aid, grants, and laptops to refugees, resulting in a cost per beneficiary of 5.34 [2]. However, the program expense ratio is 28.9%, and the low data confidence score of 0.3 reflects limited third-party verification of long-term outcomes [1][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: Afghan Refugee Relief provides essential resettlement support and financial aid to displaced Afghan families through community-driven partnerships.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.07 per $1 raised
Direct service model providing tangible assets like laptops and grants to beneficiaries
baseline_narrative.summary: Afghan Refugee Relief collaborates with local nonprofits, resettlement agencies, and religious institutions to support the integration of Afghan refugees into their new communities [2]. The organization operates several key initiatives, including Program 1, Project Sabr, and a dedicated Financial Aid program to address immediate humanitarian needs [1][2]. Donations to the organization are classified as sadaqah-eligible, supporting their mission through various giving methods [3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a moderate overall score due to its direct humanitarian impact and efficient fundraising, though it is constrained by a low program expense ratio and limited data transparency.

areas_for_improvement.context: The current <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 28.9%</cite> is well below the <cite id="5">industry standard of 75%</cite>, suggesting a high portion of funds are directed toward administrative or non-programmatic costs.
With only <cite id="11">1.3 months of working capital</cite>, the organization has a thin margin for operational stability during revenue fluctuations.

bbb_assessment.summary: This organization has not yet been evaluated against the BBB Wise Giving Alliance standards.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is in an emerging stage and may be scaling its administrative infrastructure to handle larger future grants.
risk_factors: <cite id="4">Program spending is significantly below the 89.8% peer median</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="4">critically low program expense ratio of 28.9%</cite>, which indicates that less than a third of spending goes directly to programs.

confidence.notes: Data confidence is low due to limited transparency and emerging organizational status.

alignment.improvement: Alignment could be enhanced by <cite id="17">clearly stating the zakat-eligibility status</cite> of specific programs to assist Muslim donors in their religious obligations.

credibility.explanation: Credibility is currently limited by <cite id="12">low data transparency</cite> and a small board of <cite id="13">three members</cite>. While the organization is <cite id="1">profiled by Charity Navigator</cite>, it lacks a full star rating.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should publish <cite id="14">audited financial statements</cite> and expand its board to include more independent members.

impact.explanation: The organization achieves a <cite id="15">cost per beneficiary of $5.34</cite>, which is considered exceptional for the humanitarian sector. However, the <cite id="4">28.9% program ratio</cite> significantly hinders the overall impact score.
impact.improvement: Impact could be improved by <cite id="16">building financial reserves</cite> toward a 3-12 month target to ensure long-term service continuity.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Basic theory of change and internal outcome tracking

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Distributes grants to support refugee integration and immediate needs.

rich_narrative.headline: Afghan Refugee Relief provides essential resettlement support and financial aid to displaced Afghan families through community-driven partnerships.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support the immediate, tangible needs of Afghan refugees through a lean, direct-service model and are comfortable with an emerging organization's financial profile.
donor_motivations: Want to provide specific items like laptops and phones to refugees
Value high fundraising efficiency where minimal funds are spent on marketing
Interested in supporting grassroots resettlement efforts
giving_considerations: The organization has a low program expense ratio compared to established peers
Financial data is limited and the organization is in a growth phase
Donations are only eligible as Sadaqah, not Zakat

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects <cite id="18">internal outcome tracking</cite> of outputs (laptops, aid) without external longitudinal impact studies.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: ARR facilitates refugee integration by providing immediate financial aid and essential technology to bridge the gap between arrival and self-sufficiency.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the distribution of assets like laptops actually leads to better employment or integration outcomes for refugees.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a small organization with <cite id="2">$205,225 in revenue</cite>, ARR has significant capacity to scale its financial aid and laptop programs.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by an extremely low <cite id="15">cost per beneficiary of $5.34</cite> despite a lower program ratio than peers.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on specific refugee populations at a small scale
similar_organizations.name: Rohingya Muslim Relief

similar_organizations.differentiator: Much larger global reach and higher program expense ratios
similar_organizations.name: International Rescue Committee

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a very low overhead for donor acquisition, spending only <cite id="6">$0.07 per $1 raised</cite>.
ARR successfully distributed critical technology and household goods, including <cite id="7">750 laptops and furnishing 200 homes</cite>.
The charity leverages <cite id="1">local resettlement agencies and religious institutions</cite> to maximize its reach within the Afghan community.

strengths_deep_dive: Afghan Refugee Relief excels in direct service delivery, ensuring that aid reaches beneficiaries in the form of tangible assets. Their 2023 outcomes report highlights the distribution of <cite id="8">$85,000 in financial aid</cite> and the provision of <cite id="7">1,700 phones</cite> to help refugees navigate their new environment. This directness is further evidenced by their <cite id="10">Welcome Fund grant</cite>, which recognizes their role in supporting Afghan newcomers alongside 38 other specialized organizations.
rich_narrative.summary: Afghan Refugee Relief (ARR) is a humanitarian organization dedicated to the resettlement and integration of displaced Afghan families. The organization operates through a community-driven model, <cite id="1">partnering with local nonprofits, resettlement agencies, and religious institutions</cite> to provide essential support. In 2023, the charity reported <cite id="2">total revenue of $205,225</cite>, focusing its efforts on direct service delivery. Key initiatives include <cite id="3">Project Sabr, financial aid, and women's empowerment programs</cite>, which aim to stabilize families during their transition. Despite its focused mission, the organization currently operates with a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 28.9%</cite>, which is significantly lower than the <cite id="5">peer program ratio median of 89.8%</cite> for humanitarian organizations. However, ARR demonstrates high fundraising efficiency, spending only <cite id="6">$0.07 to raise every $1</cite>. Their impact is characterized by tangible asset distribution, including <cite id="7">750 laptops and 1,700 phones</cite> provided to newcomers to facilitate communication and education. The organization also managed the distribution of <cite id="8">$85,000 in direct financial aid</cite> and <cite id="9">$260,000 in grants</cite> to support refugee needs. While the organization is a recipient of the <cite id="10">Welcome Fund grant by Welcome.US</cite>, its financial health remains lean with <cite id="11">1.3 months of working capital</cite>.
